trans-unit.source: Organizes styles that will be applied to other controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control can contain any number of style objects, or more specialized style objects that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class.
These should have unique name properties.
You can then refer to other controls on the same page by their <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property.
This class has no visual representation.
A page can also use an external style sheet, and several pages can share the same external style sheet.

For more information about styles, refer to the [\<style>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/0048ce21-2c92-4377-a211-9aca9efdf748) element and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Styles%2A> topic.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control ignores its own style attributes; setting a style attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> itself has no effect on the styles contained as children within the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Notifies the server control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Controls"></xref> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object that represents the parsed element.
the object to be added does not have a Name attribute.
Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For possible values, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Alignment%2A>.
An enumerated value specifying the alignment for the style.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Alignment"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
Gets or sets the background color for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Unlike the other properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property is not inherited from its parent.
For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit the background color of cyan.

You must explicitly set the child control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property to cyan, or you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor%2A> property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control.
This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.
The specified background color for the style.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BackColor"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control.
This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.BreakAfter"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
Clears the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
Returns the default style sheet.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default style sheet supports a number of styles.
The default style sheet.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server control persists its view state, and the view state of any child controls it contains, to the requesting client.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the server control maintains its view state; otherwise `false`.
The default is `true`.
Returns a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo"></xref> object that contains font information about the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo"></xref> that contains the font information about the control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Font"></xref> property was accessed at run time,
Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style.
Typically, this property sets the color for the text.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.ForeColor%2A> property to display text in a different color.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ForeColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The foreground <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.ForeColor"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object in the style sheet, by name.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The key used to identify the style.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style"></xref> object in the style sheet with the specified name.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState"></xref> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the control state to be restored.
Gets or sets a reference to a user control (.ascx file).
The default value is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style sheet on the page inherits the styles in a style sheet defined at the root level of the referenced user control.
For example, if the style sheet on the user control has a property named `Style1`, the page can access `Style1` as if it were in the style sheet on the page.
A reference to a user control (.ascx file).
Removes the specified style from the style sheet.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the style to remove.
The specified style does not exist.
Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the server control's current view state.
If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.
Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.StyleReference%2A> property must be the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object.
A reference to the style properties for a control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.StyleReference"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
Returns the collection of styles in a style sheet.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The collection of styles in a style sheet.
Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This object is accessible through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the control is visible on the page; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Wrapping%2A>.
An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.
Exception type
Condition
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Wrapping"></xref> property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.
